Description: Painted limestone shabti of Mahy with a blue lappet-wig, a carved brown face with black and white eyes, a red and black collar enclosing the crossed brown hands in relief, the legs are inscribed with Chapter 6 of the Book of The Dead in six rows of incised black Hieroglyphs separated by incised red lines extending around the sides.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
